channel.title: The Treatment Room
channel.description: A podcast by an esthetician, for estheticians + skincare geeks. Hi, I'm Tess! An ex-corporate employee turned licensed skin expert and virtual esthetician. Now I'm here to share in how I made beauty my business, and everything that comes along the way! Support this podcast: https://anchor.fm/the-treatment-room/support

item.description:

item.title: 102. Haircare is skincare (with Seen founder + dermatologist, Dr. Iris Rubin. )
item.description:
Welcome to The Treatment Room!

In this episode, I talk with Harvard trained derm, Dr. Iris Rubin about:

+ the acne/ haircare connection

+ hair loss

+ sensitive skin

+ rash prone skin

+ hair health tips

and more!

Want to shop Seen Haircare? 

send me an email at tessaskinconsulting@gmail.com titled "Seen" to shop the range with free shipping via Pomp Beauty.

item.title: 101. My skin + wellness rules for fall.
item.description:
Welcome to The Treatment Room!

In this episode, I am sharing some of my favorite tips as an esthetician, acne specialist and certified health coach for heading into the fall season including:

+ nutrition

+ dry skin

+ dehydrated skin

+ rash prone skin

+ managing stress

+ ezcema/ rashes 

+ acneic skin

+ seasonal changes and our hormones

+ lip care

and more!

Shop 

To shop Glymed Plus, register on the top right via my authorized store: https://glymedplus.com/home/index

HYDRO GEL https://glymedplus.com/products/GM69T

SKIN RECOVERY MIST https://glymedplus.com/products/GM33-4

Carepod HUMIDIFIER (use code TESSA15)

Un-Dew (cream cleanser)

Lo-Foam (soap-free gel cleanser)

to order CS lip SPF or JM hand cream, please email with subject line 'CS lip SPF':

tessaskinconsulting@gmail.com

item.title: 100. Heal (your hormones, thyroid and gut) with Fifi.
item.description:
Welcome to The Treatment Room!

In this episode, I chat with the queen of hormone and thyroid health, Fiona Smith.

we explore:

- hormonal acne

- thyroid health

- balanced nutrition

- protein

- why you should be weight lifting

- why balance is different for everyone

- mold + acne

- plastic + acne

CONNECT WITH FIONA

on IG/ Tiktok: @heal.with.fifi

sign up for coaching with Fiona: https://www.fionasmithcoaching.com/application+pricing

WATER FILTERS MENTIONED

Clearly filtered

Berkey

Want to support this episode and shop some Jan Marini? send me a dm: @myestytessa with the words 'JM product order' at the top, or email me: tessaskinconsulting@gmail.com with 'JM product order' in the subject line.

item.title: 98. Answering your skin + acne FAQs with Jan Marini.
item.description:
Welcome to The Treatment Room!

In this episode, I'm answering your skin FAQs with Jan Marini, founder of Jan Marini Skin Research. 

we explore:

- the link between acne and food

- acne and birth control 

- Spiranolactone and effective dosing

- retinol vs. benzoyl peroxide

- when to treat skin for aging concerns?

item.title: 97. We're lifting and we're sculpting w/ @ESTIEEALEX.
item.description:
Welcome to The Treatment Room! 

In this episode, we're talking all things MASSAGE (+ having a home business, acne tips, favorite skincare lines, and how to take care of your body as an esty.) Alex Pentecost created her own facial massage course and is a master of sculpting faces. Alex is the esthetician behind The Skin Reverie. She is a DMK therapist, facial massage, Hydrofacial, @facerealityskincare Acne expert and we loveee her!

FOLLOW ALEX aka @estieealex

BOOK W ALEX

ALEX'S COURSE LIFT + SCULPT 2.0

honorable mentions:

item.title: 95. The Most Effective Ingredients for Acne + My Glymed Recs.
item.description:
Welcome to The Treatment Room! In this episode, I am sharing the best ingredients and products for acne! 

MY SOCIAL MEDIA + SHOPS 

SHOP GLYMED PLUS (must register on the top right through my pro store or the links will not work) store label if needed: tessaskin 

BENZOYL  

skin wash (inflamed acne) 

exfoliant wash (non-inflamed acne) 

skin med (I recommend starting with no more than 5%) 

AHAs 

skin gel 

gentle facial wash 

serious action masque 

RETINOIC ACID 

retinol cream or serum 

SALICYLIC ACID 

sal-x purifying cleanser (non-inflamed acne) 

sal-x exfoliating cleanser 

SULFUR sulfur masque 

register for glymed use my referral # to earn rewards Account Id: 0023611 

Now Booking Acne Bootcamp! 

Book a skin consultation or mentorship call with me: www.tessaskin.com 

For more details on my products, visit www.freeskinbytessa.com, or follow along on instagram @freeskinbytessa.

item.title: 80. Build a Spa Business Checklist with Karlee Lauren.
item.description:
In this episode, I chat with my former mentee, Karlee Lauren, about the steps she took before opening up her spa business, and her tips for navigating the spa world as a new business owner. 

KARLEE'S CHECKLIST

1. Decide on business name (pay to register with the state and renew every 5 years- in FL its sunbiz.org)

2. Choose between LLC and Sole Proprietorship

3. Obtain an employer identification number aka EIN (aka federal tax ID number, get from the IRS)

4. Open a business bank account (keep personal separate)

5. Find a location

6. Obtain business license from the Department of Business and Professional Regulation (DBPR) renew every 2 years.

7. Submit Business Tax Application for your state to pay/collect sales and use tax. (Department of Revenue)

8. Obtain Resale Certificate to resell products without being charged sales tax when you purchase inventory.

9. Hire an accountant. (Either for monthly bookkeeping services or quarterly/yearly taxes or both. You need to pay income, self employment, and sales + use taxes.)

10. Brainstorm a business plan and choose which companies to work with. (What services/products you'll offer, equpiment, point of sale/scheduling system, policies, intake forms, consent forms, etc.)

11. Get insurance coverage for professional, general liability, and property if needed. (speak with an agent if possible- I used PPIB for my insurance.)

12. Marketing. (logo and branding colors, business cards, website design + domain, maybe get professional photos taken.)

------(we didnt really get to this in the episode, but:)

13. Physical items/details. (design your spa space, retail bags, disposable supplies, tools, aftercare cards/take home info for clients, retail shelves, wall sign, comfort items like bedding, furniture, wax pots, towel warmer, spa wraps, towels, sheets, music speaker, etc)

Questions covered:

- LLCs

- Taxes

- Quickbooks and accounting

- Setting boundaries with policies

- Permits + licenses 

- Hydrafacial 

- Deciding on skincarelines 

and more! We love you Karlee!

Connect with Karlee

Follow Karlee on IG

Book with Karlee

MY SOCIAL MEDIA + SHOPS

item.title: 73. Unpopular Opinions with Osmosis Beauty's Dr. Ben.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode I chat with the founder of Osmosis Beauty + Cosmedix, Dr. Ben Johnson. Dr. Ben takes a holistic approach to restoring the skins beauty and wellness by analyzing the skin and body as a whole, and treating skin conditions at the source. 

Dr. Ben shares his unpopular opinions on probiotics, retinol, SPF, acids/ exfoliants, nutrition and acne.

Follow Osmosis on IG: @osmosis_beauty

MY SOCIAL MEDIA + SHOPS

For more details on my products, visit www.freeskinbytessa.com, or follow along on instagram @freeskinbytessa.

Identity & Branding

item.title: 71. The Food-Skin Connection with Nutritionist, Abundant Ashley.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode I chat with my friend Ashley, certified nutritionist. Ashley believes dieting shouldn't be about deprivation. Crafting healthy versions of her favorite comfort foods is her favorite!

TW: This episode does contain discussion about foods and how they can affect our bodies. 

Follow Ashley on IG: @abundantashleyeats

Book a free consultation with Ashley

Resources mentioned:

Dr. Aviva Romm (Hormone specialist)

Adaptogen liquor alternative: Bonbuz

@bonbuz

GIVEAWAY INSTRUCTIONS:

The first listener to book a consultation with me, and follow myself @myestytessa and @abundantashleyeats on Instagram. 

The winner will receive a free Lo-Foam fragrance free cleanser! Happy booking!

item.title: 70. How to Elevate Your Treatment Room, Considering Black + Interior Design on a Budget.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode I chat with my friend Brooke Beatty, licensed esthetician and interior decorator about how to elevate your treatment room and tips for designing a space on a budget. 

Follow Brooke on Instagram

Brooke's design acct

BOOK A SERVICE W BROOKE

Esti Room Resources from Brooke!

Amazon is a great resource for bulk items, glass jars, lighting, etc. 

IKEA: Large Frames, Jars, Faux Florals, Shelving, Organization & Storage. 

Favorite Etsy Shops: GraceDigitalArtCo Maisonsuccess SaturdayPaperShop FujiPrints Wallphy KokoArtShop Hellafoil CustomSign3D LangleyMetalWorks 

Decor: HomeGoods: (Mirrors, Art, Candles, Accsesories, Chairs, Benches, Blankets, Pillows, etc) TJ Maxx: (Same as above) Local Shops: Special pieces that speak to you. 

Also great way to connect with local businesses. 

Facebook Marketplace: Cabinets, Sinks, Tables, etc 

Room Tools: Spa & Equipment: https://www.spaandequipment.com/home.php 

Glownar https://glownar.com 

Minerva Beauty https://www.minervabeauty.com 

Spa Source https://spasource.com.

item.title: 63. Hyperpigmentation with Jan Marini.
item.description:
Hi Roomies,

In this episode I'm BACK with Jan Marini, founder of Jan Marini Skin Research.

If you haven't listened to the first episode with Jan episode 40, make sure you go back and give it a go.

Today, we're talking about one of the main skin concerns I hear about: HYPERPIGMENTATION! We talk tyrosinase inhibitors, melisma, PIH, higher Fitzpatrick types/ what's at risk for POC in terms of discoloration, SPF, Albino skin, and MORE.

To shop Jan Marini, email me at tessaskinconsulting@gmail.com

JMSR is a recognized leader and innovator in skin care that is committed to continually expanding and improving the professional skin care market. item.title: 59. Acne Trigger Foods.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!!

I'm back with a solo ep talking about my most requested topic, acne trigger foods. 

DISCLAIMERS:

Please understand: no foods CAUSE acne. However, some may affect our bodily systems indirectly. While I am not a doctor or nutritionist, these are some of the foods I notice in practice can have an affect on increased acne, that also have some scientific evidence to support. 

If you are struggling with your relationship with nutrition currently, this may not be the episode for you as this episode covers food. There are no "bad" foods, and these foods are discussed in terms of their relationship to skin, NOT calories or weight gain. All of our bodies are bioindivideal, and foods that may be a trigger for one person, may not be a trigger for everyone. 

Have a topic request or question for a future episode? Comment on my latest @myestytessa.

Resource for hormone education:

Dr. Aviva Romm

Aviva Romm podcast

MY SOCIAL MEDIA + SHOPS

or DM me on Instagram to purchase IS Clinical

item.title: 53. Ageless Ashley's Guide to Holistic Skin Wellness, Instagram and Esthetician Success.
item.description:
Hi Roomies,

In this episode I chat with a major Esty role model of mine, Ashley Curtis, aka Ageless Ashley. Ashley is a licensed esthetician of 15+ years, a social media influencer, and the founder + CEO of Evolve Skin and Wellness in Pasadena. Her page is all about skin wellness, uplifting the esthetician community, glowing from within and spreading positivity. 


In this episode we chat about:

+ Ashley's journey as an esthetician, and her experiences in other fields before starting her own business

+ What holistic skincare really means + Ashley's philosophy on healthy skin

+ How Ashley approaches social media strategy, being vulnerable online, content creation... plus, how her IG popped off

+ How to give an incredible facial 

+ Building your books 

+ What went into curating her space

+ How to succeed as an Esty today + have longevity in this career

Connect with Ashley on Instagram. 


Thank you today's sponsors!

item.title: 50. How a Celebrity Makeup Artist-Turned-Esthetician Manifested Her Career + Created Her Skincare Line (with Aliesh Pierce.)
item.description:
Hi Roomies, In this episode I chat with the wonderful Aliesh Pierce, AKA Ask Aliesh. Aliesh Pierce is the founder of AskAliesh and the author of the textbook Treating Diverse Pigmentation. She is an educator and brand strategist who entered the beauty industry over 30 years ago to establish herself as a celebrity makeup artist to India.Arie, Yolanda Adams, and R.Kelly, and eventually became an esthetician, educator, brand founder and author.  In this episode we chat about: + Why neurodiversity + creativity can be your biggest assets + Why estheticians should consider creating skincare products + Original formulation vs private label + How to find a chemist + Scaling + marketing a skincare line 

Connect with Aliesh on Instagram 

Contact Aliesh Aliesh's services + courses: https://shop.askaliesh.com?aff=3

item.title: 47. Skincare Ingredients (Part II) With Esthetician + Educator Michele Phelan.
item.description:
Hi Roomies,

In this episode I'm BACK with Michele Phelan, esthetician, educator, CIDESCO diploma and owner of Concepts Institute.

Michele Phelan has been a licensed, practicing esthetician for over 30 years. She has taught esthetics at every level including; State Board, clinical/medical and CIDESCO. Michele writes the core curriculum and teaches the Clinical esthetics portion of our innovative and highly advanced program. Michele holds a B.A. Business Administration from SFSU and is also a certified nutrition coach.

Learn More About Concepts Institute or take a class

Instagram: @conceptsinstitute

In this episode, we pick up part 2 of our ingredients episode and cover ingredients such as:

+ Niacinamide

+ mandalic acid

+ azaleic acid

+ hyaluronic acid

item.title: 45. Debunking Skincare Myths with Jan Marini.
item.description:
Hi Roomies,

In this episode I'm BACK with another series episode of Behind the Brand with Jan Marini, founder of Jan Marini Skin Research.

If you haven't listened to the first episode with Jan episode 40, make sure you go back and give it a go.

Today, we're talking about skincare MYTHS.

In this episode, we cover myths surrounding:

+ Retinol + the sun

+ Rosacea versus sensitive skin

+ Oil cleansing

+ Acne Myths

+ Silicone in your skincare

+ Accutane

+ Washing your face

And much more!

About Jan Marini

JMSR is a recognized leader and innovator in skin care that is committed to continually expanding and improving the professional skin care market. JMSR's two primary focuses are to provide innovative technologies that deliver proven measurable results and an unwavering commitment to the ongoing success of our customers.

Follow Jan Marini Skin Research on IG

Learn more about Jan Marini

item.title: 43. Wellness From the Inside Out with the Beauty Internist, Dr. Posina.
item.description:
Hi Roomies,

In this episode I'm talking to Dr. Durga Sunitha Posina, M.D. a renowned board-certified physician in Internal Medicine, and also known as the beauty internist. 

Dr. Durga Sunitha Posina, M.D. is a renowned board certified physician in Internal Medicine in Stony Brook, New York. Dr. Posina was born in a small town in India before moving to the Tri-State area at a young age. An early love for science, skincare, and philanthropy fueled her determination to study medicine.

In this episode, we cover myths surrounding:

+ Sleep hygiene

+ Why supplements might not be all they're cracked up to be

+ Acne + hormone testing

+ Eating for skin health

+ The importance of skincare

+ Microneedling + Dr. Posina's favorite treatments

More about Dr. Posina + how to book with her

Follow Dr. Posina's brand on IG

@sunsimaya

MY SOCIAL MEDIA + SHOPS

item.title: 41. Confidence is Not Perfection, Medical Vs. Traditional Esthetics, Working for a Derm + When to Start That Business with NY Esthetician, Brenttany Sharraine.
item.description:
In this episode of The Treatment Room, Tess is joined by NY aesthetician and TikTok influencer + confidence coach, Brenttany Sharraine.

We discuss:

- How to build confidence + character

- How to prioritize barrier health

- Working for a dermatologist + medical aesthetics versus traditional esthetics

- The impact of environment + pollution on skin

- How to create lasting relationships with clients + carrying a conversation

- How Brenttany went from blogger and fashion student to esthetician

- Self improvement + manifesting

Connect with Brenttany on IG

item.title: 40. Jan Marini + The Acne Epidemic: Achieving Total Clearing, Scars Vs. PIH, Accutane Is Not a Cure, and Debunking "Medical Grade."
item.description:
Hi Roomies,

Welcome to another episode of #BehindTheBrand where I'm chatting with experts at top clinical skincare lines to understand the products, the technology behind them, and help esties understand what's on the market and why it works!

In this episode I'm talking to Jan Marini, founder of Jan Marini Skin Research. JMSR is a recognized leader and innovator in skin care that is committed to continually expanding and improving the professional skin care market. 

This episode covers:

  • "Medical Grade"

item.title: 35. My Tan Is Fake But My License is Real: Tanning Bed Confessions, The Vitamin D Myth, Tips For A Sun-Safe Summer + My Personal Favorite SPFs!
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode, I want to talk about a topic I'm very passionate about: limiting sun exposure. 

This episode includes:

- My history with tanning + why I'm at risk for skin cancer

- Sun protection tips

- The 2 types of sun exposure to be aware of

- Why I have "beef" with influencers that promote tanning (I'm mostly kidding, but I don't think it's responsible influencing)

- My Fav SPFs

- Why we need to #rethinksummer and consider other ways to enjoy our time on vacation without romanticizing the sun

item.title: 34. Build a Barrier: An Inside-Out Approach to Skin Health with Corneotherapy Expert + Skincare Educator, Ren Serbon.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode I'm chatting about the science and art of corneotherapy with Ren Serbon, Beauty Therapist, Electrologist, Pastiche Recognized Educator, Industry Educator, Public Speaker, and Unquenchable Skin Enthusiast.

We talk:

- What corneotherapy is

- How to incorporate corneotherapy in a standard esthetics practice

- How to repair your compromised skin barrier

- Conditions that relate to corneotherapy

- Misconceptions about corneotherapy

- How to incorporate more active ingredients into a routine without further damaging your barrier

- Holistic factors that relate to skin health

- How to approach your job with confidence + get your clients the best results possible

item.title: 27. The Acid Queen Olga Lorencin on Celebrity Skincare Lines, Sephora, Client Chemistry + Why Estheticians Are Like Gardeners.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode, I'm chatting with the Acid Queen, Olga Lorencin. Olga is an esthetician behind some of the most famous faces in Hollywood including Halle Berry + Emma Stone. 

As a celebrity skincare guru Olga is known for achieving transformative results using original, custom-blended skincare cocktails. Olgas passion was sparked growing up in Belgrade, where facials are customary as dental cleanings and skincare is approached as a science.

Learn Your Acids With Olga

https://olgalorencinskincare.com/pages/acid-guide

Connect with Olga on IG:

@olgalorencinskincare

Her website:

https://olgalorencinskincare.com

In this episode we talk:

- Client chemistry.

- How to handle difficult clients

- Why you dont need celebrities or followers to be successful

- Rosacea misconceptions

- The magic of acids

- Why estheticians are like gardeners

- Celebrity skincare, Sephora and non-experts giving advice

Shop my Glymed Store

item.title: 25. More Than Just a Light: The Benefits, Misconceptions, Mistakes + Must-Knows of LED with Concepts Institute's Michele Phelan.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode, I'm chatting with the founder of Concepts Institute of Advanced Esthetics, Michele Phelan. 

Michele Phelan has been a licensed, practicing esthetician for over 30 years. She has taught esthetics at every level including; State Board, clinical/medical and CIDESCO. Michele writes the core curriculum and teaches the Clinical esthetics portion of our innovative and highly advanced program. Michele holds a B.A. Business Administration from SFSU and is also a certified nutrition coach.

Take a class with Michele or learn more:

https://conceptsinstitute.com

Connect with Michele on IG:

@conceptsinstitute

@educatedesthies

In this episode we talk:

- what light therapy (LED) truly is

- benefits of LED

- wavelengths + what conditions they are used for 

- how to choose a legitimate device manufacturer

- some common misconceptions around light therapy and mistakes eties might be making

- why light therapy elevates your business

Love you! Thanks for listening with us. Let me know what you thought of the episode on social media!

Shop my Glymed Store

item.title: 24. Filler Can Be Your Friend, Botox Muscle Retraining, + the Diagnostic Approach to Aging with GoodSkin Clinics' Founder.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode, I'm chatting with the founder of GoodSkin Clinics, Lisa Goodman. With multiple locations bicoastally, Lisa's  company earned its reputation as a trusted North American anti-aging leader, preeminent cosmetic boutique, and medical clinic. She achieved an undergraduate in Nutrition with honors from University of Florida and went on to garner another Masters Degree in Physician Assistant Studies from Nova Southeastern University.

Now, Lisa pioneers American anti-aging by way of personalized regiments including Blanching, TackingLift, CalciumJowlLift, PRP Neppage Treatment, PRP (MD Depth) Microneedling, Threads, and Aquagold Botox + Filler Facial, and more.

GoodSkin grew from its flagship Brentwood location to a new Los Angeles locale and first New York city clinic. Along the way, she appeared in features by everyone from Vogue and W Magazine to The New York Times.

Connect with GoodSkin:

https://www.goodskinclinics.com/

Instagram: @goodskinclinics

In this episode we talk:

- how to increase client retention

- Lisa's unique diagnostic approach to skincare

- how to treat neck, chin and jowling

- how botox can be used to retrain muscles

- why filler is not the enemy!

- Lisa's recs for success in medical aesthetics

- Lisa's healthy anti aging secrets

Shop Kasey Boone's GlowSkincareLA towels with my discount code for 20% off: TESSTOWELS

https://glowskincarela.com/collections/all

item.title: 23. CBD, Discounts, MLMs, J.Lo Skincare, Client Retention + Glymed Favs with Jewellee Williams.
item.description: Hi Roomies, in this episode, I'm chatting with my friend and spa-owner, Jewellee Williams! Jewellee Williams is a Licensed Esthetician and owner of Crown Jewel Esthetics, located in Philadelphia. She specializes in corrective skin care and eyelash extensions. Jewellee currently sits as the Vice-chair of Glymed Plus's Unity Advisory Committee. item.title: 21. Like Butter + Velvet: Kasey Boone on Social Media + Her Exploding Esthetician Empire, Creating Product + Defining YOUR Version of Success.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode, I'm chatting with our esthetician QUEEN + ruler... THE Kasey Boone. 

Spa owner and esthetician, Kasey Boone has made a name for herself within the beauty industry by building her studio, GLOW Skincare, and also in creating Skin and the City her magazine and podcast. She began training in the industry at the age of 18, and by 23 had launched GLOW, her first business.

Now, fifteen years later, Kasey has positioned herself as a leader in the industry. In 2018, she was honored to be named The National Esthetician of the Year by Cosmedix skincare. Since its launch, GLOW Skincare has grown into a skincare-service studio in Woodland Hills, an area of Los Angeles. It specializes in custom skincare and skincare tools. GLOW offers custom facials, peels, hydrodermabrasion, and more. Their line of skincare tools includes the hugely popular cold rollers and #1 seller, Glow Towels which were created specifically with estheticians in mind. 

Connect with Kasey:

https://glowskincarela.com/

Instagram: 

@glowskincarela

@skin.andthe.city

In this episode we talk:

- how Kasey fell into esthetics

- her strategies that allowed her business to explode on social media + her books to fill up

- how she aims to help estheticians thrive in the industry

- her tip for every esthetician who wants to succeed 

- how and why she created her products including cold rollers + her new facial towels

- why your version of success is the version that matters

Shop my Glymed Store

My Website

MY SOCIAL MEDIA:

Tess' Instagram @myestytessa

Tess' YouTube: Tess Zolly 

Tess' TikTok: @myestytessa

Unported License https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/deed.en_US

item.title: 16. Charge What You're Worth, Esthetician "Fame," Forgive Someone + Waiting is Expensive: Tips + Tales for Career Success With Douglas Preston.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, my mentor + personal esthetician/ acne + anti aging specialist, Douglas Preston, is BACK! 

We chat:

- kick starting your future for success

- why fame isn't the true measure of success

- finance advice + tips for structuring your pricing to reflect your needs

- why late, no-show or complaining clients aren't to blame... 

- how to gain confidence as a newbie to the industry

- why you should forgive someone in your life to be happier + reap the financial rewards

ABOUT MY GUEST:

Douglas Preston's career in esthetics and day spa  management spans more than 37-years. He has owned and operated  award-winning day spas, authored scores of industry articles and books,  appeared as guest lecturer and host at numerous top esthetic and spa  trade shows, and maintains a private skincare practice at his luxurious  salon Preston Skin Center http://www.prestonskincenter.com located in Los Gatos, CA.

Preston  consults for individual professional estheticians and large spa/beauty  organizations internationally. He has helped hundreds of businesses and  esthetics practitioners achieve impressive levels of success, both in  income growth and management efficiencies.

Thank you to today's sponsors:

SNOW teeth whitening for my brightest ever smile!

- Go to trysnow.com and use my code TREATMENT for 15% off your first order. YOU GUYS IM IN LOVEEEEE.

And Gemmist haircare for my customized hair routine! 

Right now my listeners can give Gemmist a try and get 20 percent off their shampoo & conditioner subscription! Just visit Gemmist.com to get your personalized recommendation and enter code TREATMENT.

https://gemmist.com/?promo=TREATMENT&utm_source=micropodcast&utm_medium=jaybird&utm_campaign=202102

MY SOCIAL MEDIA:

Tess' Instagram @myestytessa

Tess' YouTube: Tess Zolly

item.title: 15. Unlimit Your Beliefs, How to Build REAL Confidence + The Dirt on Esthetics + Nursing With My Former Classmate.
item.description:
Hi  Roomies, in this episode I am talking about with Anja Maia, my friend and former esthetician school class mate. 

In this episode we discuss

- Unlimiting your beliefs so you CAN HAVE your dream life

- Trying the things that excite you in life without imagining consequences

- The reality of being a nurse/ esthetician

- Why self care is not optional

- How to build confidence, and more!

item.title: 14. Should You Be Your Own Boss? Lessons From A New Entrepreneur, Esthetician and Former Shy Girl.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode I am talking about the lessons I have recently learned as a new business owner/ entrepreneur! I wanted to share more about the mental and emotional side that can come with stepping up to the plate as your own boss. 

In this episode we cover:

- Setting your boundaries with clients

- Knowing your "no's"

- Why there is no one way to be an entrepreneur

- How to know if business is right for you

- Why you must hire out for your weaknesses

- How to set your intentions in your business

item.title: 13. The Art of Extractions, How to Manage Your Acne + Skincare on Social Media with Esthetician + TikToker Skincare by Michelle.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode I am talking with Michelle Esposito, also known as @skincarebymichelle on TikTok. Michelle has over 20 years in the industry as an esthetician, and owns her own spa, Organic Skin Therapy Spa, in Houston, Texas. 

In this episode we cover:

- The value of a professional's help + quality skincare

- why estheticians can go underappreciated

- inflamed and non-inflamed acne

- why facials are game-changing

- extraction tips for estheticians

- how you can (more safely) extract a non-inflamed whitehead at home

- why Michelle thinks skincare should be simple

- why AHAs/BHAs are some of her favorite ingredients and acne treatments

- her biggest social media tip

- why word of mouth matters for your business

Connect With Michelle on IG:

@skincare_bymichelle

and Tiktok: @skincarebymichelle

item.title: 12. Mite We Talk Rosacea? Treatments, Ingredients to Use, What Not to Do, Diet + Lifestyle Triggers with Skin Coach Julie.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode we are talking ROSACEA!

If you are interested in:

- what causes rosacea

- what new esthetician students should understand about rosacea

- what ingredients to use for clients with rosacea

- how rosacea is treated

- what to avoid (diet and lifestyle triggers)

- how rosacea clients can manage the condition, and flare ups, this episode is for you!

ABOUT MY GUEST:

Julie Resce is a licensed esthetician, educator, formulator and founder of Six Figure Esthetician Virtual Courses. She has worked in day spas and med spas, and owned a spa in the Chicago area.

Julie Resce has created an online platform where estheticians and other skin care professionals can come to get relevant, useful and accurate information in the form of easy to follow online courses.  Her website is skincoachjulie.com.  Her courses are 70% off right now. 

Her  most popular course include: Consultation and Skin Analysis, Mastering  Skin and Treatments, Ingredient Expert and Acne Solutions. Her Microneedling course will be launching in January of 2021. I am obsessed with her courses, and highly encourage you to try them!

Connect with Julie on IG: @esthetician_virtual_training

Huge thanks to Podcorn for  sponsoring this episode. Explore sponsorship opportunities and start  monetizing your podcast by signing up here: https://podcorn.com/podcasters/

MY SOCIAL MEDIA:

item.title: 11. Private Labeling 101: Start A Skin Label, Make More $, Inspire Your Audience + Create Loyalty Within Your Brand.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode we are talking about private labeling in esthetics and skincare! 

If you are interested in:

  • creating a skincare line or beauty brand
  • how to customize and brand a product
  • how a small spa business can position themselves along major retailers
  • creating a product to fill a gap in the beauty market or your own spa
  • harness your social audience + direct them toward your e-commerce brand
  • leverage your own brand for your virtual consultations
  • make more $ for yourself by controlling your profit margins
  • cutting out the middle man in your business and having more control over your products
  • avoiding price wars/ d=getting undercut by the competition

this episode is for you! I'm discussing the pros and cons of private labeling.

Here are more resources on the topic:

Beneficial ingredients/ manufacturers to work with:

https://www.dermascope.com/game-changers/private-label

The case against private labeling:

https://www.dermascope.com/business/the-case-against-private-label

JoeElle Lee's website, courses + contact:

https://www.joelleskincare.com/


Huge thanks to Podcorn for  sponsoring this episode. Explore sponsorship opportunities and start  monetizing your podcast by signing up here: https://podcorn.com/podcasters/

item.title: 10. Resetting Our Mental Health + Nutrition: There's An App for That! @NourishWithJass on Bloating, Probiotics, Sugar + Skin.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode we are talking how we can improve our overall mental health + nutrition, make meals we enjoy, make food choices for longevity, and prevent anxiety with actionable tools.

If you are interested in nutrition, tips to optimize digestion, better overall skin health and immunity, and tips to be a successful entrepreneur or business person in your field, this episode is for you!

I partnered with Shape and Foster's Calum McGuigan + @NourishWithJass' Jass Stupak on this episode, a lifestyle development app that gives you access to six top industry experts focused on optimizing mental health including:

  • Financial Literacy (Shinobu Hindert)
  • Mental Health (Tania DaSilva)
  • Fitness (Ty McDonald)
  • Nutrition (Jass Stupak)
  • Life Coaching (Christina Rowland)
  • Yoga (Morgan Daloisio)

item.title: 9. Design the Client Base You Want, Give the Services You Love + E-Commerce Sucess with an Aesthetician + Spa Owner.
item.description:
Hi Roomies, in this episode I'm joined my spa owner and esthetician, Nichelle Mosley!

She is a North Carolina board certified aesthetician and her education includes: certified laser technician, and certified advanced  paramedical aesthetic training.  She created Queen City Group to empower women and embrace their beauty. Her practice includes clinical, integrative and holisitic skin care solutions for hyper-pigmentation, sun damage, acne, rosacea or wrinkles, fine lines, and body contouring.

If you have an interest in starting your own business, e-commerce, carving out a niche, why you need physical spf, avoiding celebrity skincare lines, learning about new modalities in esthetics, why we should advocated for professional grade skincare, or better understanding how to treat multicultural skin and acne with the step up approach, this episode is for you! 

Connect with Nichelle on Instagram:

@queencitybeautygroup

Shop Nichelle's professional wholesale products, book a treatment, shop her skincare and more:

https://www.queencitybeautygroup.com

item.title: 8. I'm Creating a Skincare Line! + How to be a Virtual Esthetician, The Art of the Consultation, Your Biggest Social Media Tool + New Client Tips.
item.description:
Hello hello roomies! If you have an interest in creating a virtual esthetics business and improving your consultations, this episode is for you!!

In this episode we are talking:

  • how to have success on social media 
  • why your authentic story is the most valuable tool you have to offer
  • consultation tips
  • why there's not one single way to be an estie
  • why your intake form should be unique

item.title: 7. Turn Back The Clock With a Beverly Hills Anti-Aging Doctor As We Chat PDO Threads, Botox, Lip Filler, Hormones + Getting Your Foot in the Medical Aesthetics Door.
item.description:
Hello hello roomies! If you have an interest in cosmedic procedures or medical aesthetics, this episode is for you!!

It was a pleasure to have the incredible Dr. Rahi on the show, who owns a thriving medical aesthetics practice in Beverly Hills, Los Angeles. Dr. Rahi is a known name in  the field of aesthetics, integrative and anti-aging medicine and a reputation of an innovator whose mission is to build perfect solutions that carry both cosmetic rejuvenation and  inner health. She is all about a holistic and integrative approach when treating her patients, which we love! It's truly unique to find someone who meshes two of my favorite worlds (medical esthetics and integrative medicine) for long term patient happiness that addresses the root cause of aging + imbalance.

In this episode we are getting plumped and lifted, talking:

  • PDO threads
  • lip filler vs lip flip
  • pros + cons of botox and filler
  • hormone balance + sleep
  • microneedling
  • medical grade skincare
  • getting your start in medical esthetics
  • running a successful medical/ beauty practice
  • beauty from the inside out!

A HUGE thank you to today's sponsors.

- This episode is in partnership with my favorite beauty resource, Allure!

New episodes every Thursday. Listen to Allure: The Science of Beauty at listen.allure.com/tess, or wherever you get your podcasts.

Follow + book with Dr. Rahi:

Her website:

https://doctorrahi.com/about/

podcast:

https://doctorrahi.com/my-podcast/

Instagram:

@doctorrahimd

Tess' Instagram @myestytessa

Tess' YouTube: Tess Zolly 

Tess' TikTok: @myestytessa

item.title: 6. In the Modern Esthetician We Trust: Medical Esthetics, Niching Down, Client Trust, Happiness is the Secret Sauce, + Why If She's Doing It, You Can Too.
item.description:
In this episode we are talking to none other than the first "esthetician influencer" I ever stumbled upon, Kelsey Sehrt of The Modern Esthetician. 

Kelsey  Serht is an Aesthetician, skin care coach and blogger with a passion  for beauty, skin care, and the science behind it all. She has been featured by various skin care companies such as Lightstim,  iecsc, Truth Treatments and Obagi Medical to name a few. Kelsey  specializes in medical grade skincare and services, testing beauty  products from all over the world & discovering which skin care  products are clinically proven to be most effective. Plus, she feels like your big sister and mentor wrapped up in one radiant, joyful, encouraging and positive package. 


In this episode, we talk:

  • medical esthetics + working for a dermatologist
  • why you should work at a medical spa
  • niching down for success
  • having an abundance mindset
  • how to build trust with clients
  • having an abundance mindset, as opposed to a lack
  • what true customer service really is
  • and why happiness is the secret sauce

A HUGE thank you to today's sponsors.

- This episode is in partnership with my favorite beauty resource, Allure!

New episodes every Thursday. Listen to Allure: The Science of Beauty at listen.allure.com/tess, or wherever you get your podcasts.

- Try my favorite new lifestyle app, Shape Add Foster, for 14 days free at:

https://www.shapeandfoster.com

or download the app "Shape And Foster":

https://apps.apple.com/us/app/shape-foster/id1537022587

CONNECT WITH KELSEY:

Instagram: @themodernesthetician

Youtube

Her Website

My SOCIAL MEDIA

YouTube: Tess Zolly 

TikTok: @myestytessa

item.title: 5. Estie On the Line: From Managing Treatment Room Anxiety to Getting Your First Job... Talking to Esthetician Students About Their Top Concerns!
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode I'm chatting with YOU GUYS! For the first time, I'm starting my new series called "Estie On The Line" where I will be taking esthetician student callers to give advice and address concerns. We chat: the difference between school versus the real world finding the right "fit" and first job how to manage anxiety in the treatment room with grounding techniques and confidence builders avoiding estie "auto-pilot" and staying in the moment with your client by doing this one thing A HUGE thank you to today's sponsors. 

- This episode is in partnership with my favorite beauty resource, Allure!

item.title: 4. Raising Eyebrows + Saving Lashes: When to Fire Your Client, The "New-School" Esthetician Bond + How to Get Started As a Lash Artist ft. Glow & Go Beauty Co.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode I'm chatting with one of my esty besties Jacky Zuzu, owner of Glow and Go Beauty Co., an exclusive beauty studio featuring eyelash  enhancements, brow lamination, and organic airbrush tanning. It is  conveniently located in the heart of the Marina District in San Francisco. We talk some lesser talked about topics, such as:

  • firing your clients
  • what an esthetician should and shouldn't tolerate
  • implementing late and no-show policies
  • how to build a clientele
  • the old school vs new-school rules for cultivating a genuine bond with clients
  • how to find a great location for your salon/spa
  • subleasing vs leasing a space
  • how to become a lash extension artist
  • technical tips for lash artists
  • how to be a strong business owner
  • pros and cons of working for someone else before starting your business
  • what Jacky would tell her former self as a new esthetician

A HUGE thank you to today's sponsors. 

- This episode is in partnership with my favorite beauty resource, Allure!

New episodes every Thursday. Listen to Allure: The Science of Beauty at listen.allure.com/tess, or wherever you get your podcasts.

- This episode is sponsored by Hum Nutrition. 

To help boost your wellbeing in the ways you need it most, take their quick quiz and get individualized product recommendations from their team of registered dietitians to help bring your skin, body, hormones and mood into balance with HUM Nutrition at HUMNutrition.com. 

Use my code TREATMENT and get 15% off your first order of $29+.

item.title: 3. Maximizing Your Client Consultations, Ingredient Labels, Virtual Facials, How to Get Hired + What's the Deal with Essential Oils? (Ft. Michele Phelan)
item.description:
Hey Roomies! Welcome to season 2. This episode features Michele Phelan, founder of Concepts Institute of Advanced Esthetics. Michele has been one of my favorite teachers, mentors + humans throughout my career, and offers many classes online such as chemical peels, ingredients, skin analysis, microcurrent, understanding acne, and more! 

 In this episode we talk:

  • How to offer quality of care
  • tips for skin analysis + consults
  • how to create a strong homecare routine for your client
  • how being a new esthetician can be one of your greatest assets
  • virtual facials + taking your esthetics business online
  • pros and cons of essential oils
  • how to read ingredient labels more effectively
  • hiring and firing in your business
  • what Michele looks for when she hires estheticians
  • how to be a top notch esthetician

A HUGE thank you to today's sponsors.

- This episode is in partnership with my favorite beauty resource, Allure!

New episodes every Thursday. Listen to Allure: The Science of Beauty at listen.allure.com/tess, or wherever you get your podcasts.

item.title: 2. How A Health + Confidence Coach Healed Her Toxic Relationship With Food, Left the Corporate Life, Became Her Own BFF + Turned It Into a Business.
item.description:
Hey Roomies! Welcome to season 2. This episode features our first guest of the season (yay!!), Mrs. Kailey Mann! We are so lucky to have Kailey join us for a heartfelt conversation around health, food, body image and confidence. Kailey is a Certified Integrative Nutrition Health Coach and Nutrition School graduate. 

Trigger warning. We have only the most positive intentions behind our words. In this episode we talk:

  • disordered eating
  • quitting our corporate jobs at E! News where we met
  • why the 9 to 5 life wasn't for us
  • the fine line between health and restriction
  • how you can shift your nerves and anxiety to actually benefit yourself
  • how and when she started her business, and tips for launching
  • Kailey's actionable items and recs for dealing with anxiety
  • and the mission of Kailey's new health coaching business, Your Best Feeling Forever

- This episode is sponsored by Hum Nutrition.

To help boost your wellbeing in the ways you need it most, take their

item.itunes:summary:
Hey Roomies! Welcome to season 2. This episode features our first guest of the season (yay!!), Mrs. Kailey Mann! We are so lucky to have Kailey join us for a heartfelt conversation around health, food, body image and confidence. Kailey is a Certified Integrative Nutrition Health Coach and Nutrition School graduate. 

Trigger warning. We have only the most positive intentions behind our words. In this episode we talk:

  • disordered eating
  • quitting our corporate jobs at E! News where we met
  • why the 9 to 5 life wasn't for us
  • the fine line between health and restriction
  • how you can shift your nerves and anxiety to actually benefit yourself
  • how and when she started her business, and tips for launching

It's me, Tess, and I'm on my own this season! I hope you enjoy everything that's to come in the future of this podcast. I am committed to provided THE best resources for your esthetician education. We've got a lot in store for season 2, so get comfy! 


If you have any suggestions for future guests, episode topics, or questions you need answers to, please let me know!You can reach me by commenting on any of my social channels!

item.title: 59. You Got Your License, Now What? Navigating Post-Grad Estie Life, Your First Job May Not Be Forever, and Interview Tips! (Season Finale)
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode Tess is talking through all the tips for:

  • what to expect after graduation
  • why the transition from estie school to real life is just that, a tradition
  • why your first job after estie school doesn't have to be "the one"
  • questions you can expect in an esthetician interview and how to prepare
  • how to apply to get the job YOU want, not the job you see

This episode is also sponsored by Forager Project, a 100% organic plant-based California food company. Forager wants to inspire everyone to get out and vote and participate in our democracy. GET OUT AND VOTE! They have provided voting resources and information for you at www. foragerproject.com/vote and on social @foragerproject

item.title: 58. Just a Heart to Heart With Tess: Check on Your Strong Friends, Mental Breakdowns, Part of My New Business, Left Turns, Smaller To-Do Lists + Be the Hypeman.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode we're just having an old fashioned sleepover style heart to heart. I want to be just as open about some of my lows as I am about my highs. Although I might look like I have it together at all times, I can assure you I don't! That's why I think it's important, now more than ever, we check on our strong friends and hype each other up. Let's chat:

  • part of my new business update
  • how I'm ACTUALLY doing
  • why you need to be stoked on your friends' accomplishments, ideas, positive new relationships + new endeavors
  • why we love a left turn + having the courage to listen to your business instincts and curiosities
  • why I want LESS clients + a smaller to do list
  • my upcoming brain therapy treatment (Ceraset)
  • my plans for the podcast as a solo endeavor + season 2!
  • supporting Lauren's decision to move on from the podcast
  • part of my new business update

This episode is also sponsored by Forager Project, a 100% organic plant-based California food company. Forager wants to inspire everyone to get out and vote and participate in our democracy. GET OUT AND VOTE! They have provided voting resources and information for you at www. foragerproject.com/vote and on social @foragerproject

If you find value in this episode it would mean so much if you left us a 5 star review on iTunes-- it helps other professionals find us and appreciate us as credible sources.

Tess' Instagram @myestytessa.dermaplus + Tess' YouTube: Tess Zolly 

Tess' TikTok: @myestytessa.dermaplus

Music by LiQwYd

item.title: 57. "Hate to See Her Go, Love to Watch Her Leave..." Sad News Update: Lauren is Leaving The Treatment Room + Starting Her Next Chapter.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! 

Well, sad day. Lauren is making the tough decision to leave the pod so she can focus all of her energy on her new business!! We are so excited + happy for her. Above all, our message to listeners is that YOU create your own path, and you have the right to change it at any time. And, sometimes even making the "right" decision for you at a certain time can make you sad, and that's okay. We love and support Lauren, and can't wait to see what she does next. She WILL be back!! 

Don't worry, the pod is here to stay, and Tess will be continuing on to bring you all the esty + skin content your hearts desire. Thank you so much for sticking with us and supporting us during this tough transition!

Stay connected with Lauren:

Lauren's Instagram: @laurens.esthetics + Lauren's YouTube: Lauren Kruger

Lauren's Blog: www.lauren-kruger.com

Music by LiQwYd https://soundcloud.com/liqwyd

--- Support this podcast: https://anchor.fm/the-treatment-room/support

item.title: 56. Roomie Chats: Skincare Influencers, Cerave, Embarassing Spa Moments, Study Hacks + Blocking Out the Social Media Haters.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! In this episode we are keepinng it caj and answering some of your esthetician listener questions! We discuss how to deal with haters (online, in the work place, etc), tips for note taking in school, how to handle a toxic work place, overcoming mistakes in the treatment room/ spa, our most embarrassing moment in the spa, cerave + the drugstore product conversation, overcoming haters, and the dark side of social media.

item.title: 54. Listen Before Starting Your Beauty Brand! Saian Skin Care's CEO on Treating Ethnic Skin, The Reality of Entrepreneurship + Self Care.
item.description:
We partnered with Layer Origin to bring you this podcast.

To learn more about Layer Origin and prebiotics, head to www.LayerOrigin.com
Use code TREATMENT at checkout to save 20% off your  order at www.LayerOrigin.com

Hi Roomies!! As some of you may know, we thrive off of seeking out the TOP estheticians, experts and educators in the field so we can pass on our learnings to you! In this episode we dive into the philosophy behind natural clinical brand, Saian Skin Care, created by a mother daughter duo. Saian specializes in the most advanced natural hypoallergenic skincare products containing no artificial color, no artificial fragrance, and no parabens for use on the most sensitive and ethnic skin. We chat best ingredients for skin of color, why you SHOULDN'T start a skincare line, cultivating an authentic business to business community, what it takes to build a beauty brand from the ground up, how to eat and take care of your body for optimal health, lower inflammation and better skin, and much more!

If you find value in this episode it would mean so much if you left us a 5 star review on iTunes-- it helps other professionals find us and appreciate us as credible sources. 

Sain Skin Care IG: @saian_skincare

https://saian.net

item.title: 53. We Learned From the Best (Skincare Icons!) The 10 Industry Lessons That Made Us Better Estheticians.
item.description:
Hi Roomies!! As some of you may know, we thrive off of seeking out the TOP estheticians, experts and educators in the field so we can pass on our learnings to you! In this episode we are giving you the cliff notes of the top 10 lessons we have learned about esthetics from our guests, including JoeEllle Lee, Shelley Hancock, Danna Omari (Noyskincare), Renee Rouleau, Nerida Joy, Douglas Preston and more! We love all of our guests and although we couldn't mention all, we highly encourage you to go back and listen to more interviews! We had fun with this one, and we hope you enjoy!

Huge thanks to the sponsor of this episode!

item.title: 51. We Need to Go Beyond Basic: Tess' Favorite Classes for Outside Esthetics Education.
item.description:
Hi Roomies! Enjoy this solo episode with Tess highlighting her favorite esthetics courses to take outside of school! Some classes are free or virtual so there's no reason NOT to continue learning while quarantined. We hope it helps you to go beyond the basic education provided in school. I hope everyone is doing as amazing as they can be in quarantine. I know it can be difficult if you are in esthetician school to stay motivated, keep your eye on the prize and continue to learn. I hope this information is the encouragement you need to keep pushing yourself forward! 

Huge thanks to the sponsors of this episode!

item.title: 48. The Medical History + NASA Origin Story Behind Light Therapy: LightStim's Educator on How Estheticians + Your Clients can Benefit From the Device
item.description:
Hi Treatment Roomies! In today's episode we are talking with Lightstim's esthetician and educator Richard Maher. Maher is an oncology-trained aesthetician and massage therapist based in Orange County, California. With over a decade of expertise in wellness, beauty, and education, Maher acts as the communications director and national educator for LightStim, assisting in the formation of their advanced LED light therapy curriculum and supplementary programs.

We hope this gives you a greater understanding of how you can utilize light therapy in the treatment room and as retail for your clients' homecare!

Lauren's Instagram: @laurens.esthetics + Lauren's Website: www.lauren-kruger.com

Tess' Instagram @myestytessa.dermaplus + Tess' YouTube: Tess Zolly

Tess TikTok: @myestytessa.dermaplus

https://lightstim.com/

Skin shows: 

https://livelovespa.com

https://northerncal.faceandbody.com

Oncology Spa Solutions training 

https://www.oncologyspasolutions.com

item.title: 43. Celebrity Esthetician JoElle Lee on Treating Multicultural Skin, Finessing your Extractions, and the Importance of Finding Your NICHE
item.description:
Hi Treatment Roomies!! In this episode we are talking with JoElle Lee - Michelle Obama's personal esthetician who has been in the space for 20 years and boasts accomplishments such as starting her own skincare line, writing two best selling books, and starting her own education program for esties. We talk with her about her specialities that include treating multicultural skin and working with chemical peels. We discuss finding your niche, and why you SHOULDN'T rent your own suite straight out of estie school.

JoElle's information:

Her Books Here

www.joelleskincare.com & www.joellelee.com

IG @joellelee_estheticstraining

FB Group https://www.facebook.com/groups/705749119851571/

Educate, Donate, Participate for Justice:

https://blacklivesmatter.com

https://www.standwithbre.com

Tess' TikTok @myestytessa.dermaplus

item.title: 40. A Medical Esthetics Dr. on The Importance of NICHE, How to Get a Job at a MediSpa + Preventative Aging Tips for Face + Body
item.description:
Hi treatment Roomies, 

Welcome to our episode with Dr. Chris Bacci of Marin Medical Esthetics. We hope this eppisode broadens your scope + knowledge of medical esthetics. In this interview, we're covering how to get a job at a medical spa + what this doctor looks for in hiring nurses and estheticians, the importance of having a niche in your aesthetics business,  new groundbreaking tech for skin tightening, cellulite and muscle tone like Emsculpt, as well as tips for a good skincare routine and preventing early signs of aging in your 20s. This episode may be of particular interest if you are a nurse, esthetician, esthetician/nursing student, or just interested in the fascinating world of medical esthetics and body treatments. 

Xoxo, Tess & Lo

Lauren's Instagram: @laurens.esthetics + Lauren's Blog www.lauren-kruger.com

Tess' Instagram @myestytessa.dermaplus + Tess' YouTube: Tess Zolly

Music by LiQwYd

--- Support this podcast: https://anchor.fm/the-treatment-room/support

item.title: 29. Noy Skincare's Danna Omari on her struggle with acne, sucking after esthetics school, determination + 'resetting' the skin
item.description:
Today we are talking with Danna Omari of Noy Skincare. She shares her journey through the esthetics field from being a brand new esthetician, sucking at it, seeking guidance and being shut out by other estheticians, and how she excelled and now runs an insanely cool esthetics practice and is known for her extremely effective buccal facial massage technique.

Xoxo, Tess & Lo

www.noyskincare.com

item.title: 28. From Hardship to Hustle: How A Lash Artist Turned Minimum Wage Into Her Own Thriving Beauty Brand
item.description:
Have you ever dreamed of being your own beauty business boss? Today Tess is chatting with lash artist + beauty business owner of Glow And Go Beauty Co, Jacky Zuzu! We talk how a family hardship caused her to switch plans, swapping her degree as a therapist for beauty  school, and how she turned her minimum wage lash job into her beauty brand, offering brow, lash and tanning service to San Francisco's prominent Marina District clientele. Xoxo, Tess & Lo

https://www.glowandgobeautyco.com

Find Jacky on Instagram: @glowandgobeautyco

item.title: 25. How to Handle Criticism and Adversity in a Career that Hinges on Outside Approval & Lauren's Favorite Resources to Keep Your Mind Right
item.description:
Hey friends! Lauren here for a solo episode about how to handle criticism and adversity in an industry that relies so heavily on the approval of our clients. I am talking about how to separate your professional self from your personal self. Criticism in work does not dictate who you are as a person! I am also talking about some of my favorite resources to keep your mind and spirit healthy in this chaotic world.

Lauren's Instagram: @laurens.esthetics

item.title: 19. Becoming the Beauty Business Girl Boss Of Your Dreams With @iam_kellyann
item.description:
GUYS! Wow. We hope you love this episode! We spoke with salon owner, spray tan educator + beauty busuiness coach KellyAnn Callaghan about how to make the actual leap and pursue your beauty business dreams, and all the skills + grit it takes along the way. Whether you are hoping to take the leap and open your own salon (but don't know how), step out your current role and into your passion, get some inspiration to level up to your potential, offer better customer service, or create a beauty product, this episode is for you!

Xo, Tess and Lo

item.description:

item.title: 16. How I'm Managing My Acne (Tess Solo Episode)
item.description: Hi friends, Tess here. In this episode I am discussing my journey with acne, how my struggle has given my career purpose, and what I am doing to minimize the condition (as well as what I'm NOT doing ) I hope it helps! Please let me know what you think and feel free to DM me if you have any questions or want to discuss this topic further! item.title: 11. Anxiety in the Treatment Room: Managing Your Own Nerves for Calmer Services
item.description:
If you're feeling nervous in the treatment room, yes it's ironic, but it's not abnormal! In this episode we are covering lifestyle hacks fro calmer services, possible triggers for anxiety in the treatment room, and how we work around those! We would love to hear what you do to battle anxiety - leave us a comment on Instagram and let's have a chat! Let us know what you think by leaving us a review! Looking forward to your feedback! Xo, Tess + Lo 

Tess' Instagram @myestytessa.dermaplus + Tess' YouTube: Tess Zolly  Lauren's Instagram: @laurens.esthetics Music by LiQwYd

item.title: 10. Fill Your Own Cup | Our Self Care + Why Energy Makes A Difference
item.description:
Hi everyone! Today we are talking about self care, how we fill our own cups, and why it's important to take care of yourself first so you can give your best to your clients. We would love to hear what you do for yourself as well - leave us a comment on Instagram and let's have a chat!

Let us know what you think by leaving us a review! Looking forward to your feedback! Xo, Tess + Lo

item.title: 9. Why Spas Fail + You're Not A Salesperson | With Acne/Anti-Aging Skin Specialist Douglas Preston
item.description:
Hi everyone! In this episode we're sitting down with skin expert, spa consultant/ owner + Bay Area acne + anti-aging specialist Douglas Preston of Preston SKin Center. We talk product sales, homecare routines, mistakes new estheticians make, fads that don't work in skincare, and the best ingredients for acne + anti aging. We hope you enjoy!

Let us know what you think by leaving us a review! Looking forward to your feedback! Xo, Tess + Lo

Tess' Youtube interview with Douglas 

Preston's Website (tips, book a facial, buy his extractor tool)

Preston's mentorship resource

Tess' Instagram @myestytessa.dermaplus + Tess' YouTube: Tess Zolly 

Lauren's Instagram: @laurens.esthetics

Music by LiQwYd
